page.title: 19TRANSPORT in WADESMILL
page.content: The main road,the A10 follows the line of Ermine Street, the Roman Road built from London to Lincoln. It passes through the villages of Wadesmill and Thundridge and separates one half of each village from the other. The volume and speed of the traffic using this road in both directions makes crossing the road extremely hazardous especially as there are no crossings or traffic lights. A survey done for one hour on a week day morning showed 519 vehicles going towards Cambridge and 469 towards London. At peak times in the morning and evening when commuters are travelling the traffic is even heavier. However a massive thirteen million pound bypass for Wadesmill has now been announced. The local vicar says this will give the villages a proper sense of identity and development. It is hoped to start building in 1989.
